c74object.name: bach.prod
c74object.digest: Multiply all numbers in an llll
c74object.description: Takes the product of all the numbers of the incoming llll.

inlet.digest: The llll whose numbers must be multiplied

method.name: bang
method.description: Outputs the number of factors and the result of calculation performed on the most recently received input llll.

method.name: llll
method.digest: Multiply all numbers and output result
method.description: All the numbers of the incoming llll are multiplied, the number of such factors is output through the right outlet, and the result of the product is output through the left outlet. Non-numbers are simply ignored. The number of multiplied elements also depends on the maxdepth attribute.

attribute.name: maxdepth
attribute.description:
You can use a maxdepth attribute in order to decide until which level of depth numbers must be considered for the product. The default is 0, meaning: all levels.
maxdepth sets the maximum depth level at which the operation must be performed. If negative, the depth level is counted from the innermost level of each branch of the tree. A value of 0 is not accepted. Defaults to -1, i.e. there is no limitation (stop at the innermost level).

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the followings:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.

c74object.discussion: bach.prod only operates on numbers; each non-number element is simply ignored.

entry.name: Inlet 1 (llll)
entry.description: The llll whose numbers must be multiplied.

entry.name: More details
entry.description: bach.prod only operates on numbers; each non-number element is simply ignored.
